contentfulPage.title: Plank 2: Enact common sense pretrial justice

description.raw: {"nodeType":"document","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"We must build a new framework for pretrial justice that maximizes pretrial liberty while ending racial and wealth-based discrimination.","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]}

detailPageTitle.pageHeadline: Plank 2: Enact common sense pretrial justice

richText.raw: {"nodeType":"document","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"heading-3","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Every night, nearly half a million people sit in jail across America — and not because they’ve been convicted of any crime, but often because they can’t afford money bail. ","marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Our current system of incarcerating so many people while they’re legally innocent is racist, morally reprehensible, and unconstitutional. This profound injustice devastates families and communities. Being jailed before trial rips parents from their families. It increases people’s likelihood of conviction and of committing another crime. It causes people who are detained to lose their jobs and homes. It significantly increases the likelihood of future unemployment for those detained. It exposes people to infectious disease, mental illness, unsanitary conditions, sexual assault, and even death from suicide, violence, or medical inattention. Put simply, it robs billions of dollars from communities and the economy, and it causes immeasurable harm to those who can least afford it.","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"The time has come to completely overhaul the pretrial system and build a system that supports people and maximizes their pretrial liberty. Drastically reducing the number of people incarcerated pretrial means less money spent on jails and more money spent on local community-based efforts surrounding restorative justice, child care, housing, mental health and drug treatment, and other non-carceral programs. These sorts of investments will help keep communities safe while allowing people facing charges to show up for their court dates without the use of restrictive conditions. It is time to make policy changes that will ensure pretrial liberty — and human dignity — is protected for all people.","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]}

content.raw: {"nodeType":"document","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"heading-4","content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Ensure that eligibility for pretrial detention is extremely limited, including only the most serious felony cases, and eliminate money as a way of unconstitutionally detaining people.","marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"data":{}}],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"paragraph","content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"","marks":[],"data":{}}],"data":{}}]}

{"nodeType":"document","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"heading-4","content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Before imposing conditions or detention, require robust hearings — with counsel present — that start by presuming innocence and, accordingly, release. ","marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"data":{}}],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"paragraph","content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"","marks":[],"data":{}}],"data":{}}]}

{"nodeType":"document","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"heading-4","content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Provide all people with pretrial supports, including text message reminders, child care, transportation assistance, and housing.","marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"data":{}}],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"paragraph","content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"","marks":[],"data":{}}],"data":{}}]}

promo1.title: Ensure an effective right to counsel

text.raw: {"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"States must fulfill their Sixth Amendment obligations and ensure a high-quality system of indigent defense. ","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}

{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"States must stop criminalizing poverty and start using treatment, community investments, and social supports to address social problems.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}
